page.title: 15Walks starting from Wroxton.
page.content: This area of the project is covered in the main by fields with the exception of part of the western edge of Banbury town and Wroxton village. In this beautiful area the County Council has created two main circular walks in addition to numerous other footpath routes. Both of these start from Wroxton village, one going north and west to the villages of Horley, Hornton, Alkerton, Shenington and Balscott. This route is about ten miles. A shorter walk goes south towards North Newington and then east before returning to Wroxton along the edge of the Bretch Hill estate in Banbury. Both routes give the walker the opportunity to see the abundant wild life in the area as well as a number of typical North Oxfordshire villages with their thatched houses built in the local brown ironstone.
